snippet: The United States added 115,000 jobs in April, lower than expected and far below the number needed to keep up with population growth. The report provides some momentum for Mitt Romney. Richard W. Stevenson reports.
abstract: The United States added 115,000 jobs in April, lower than expected and far below the number needed to keep up with population growth. The report provides some momentum for Mitt Romney. Richard W. Stevenson reports.

byline.original: By EMILY B. HAGER and NADIA SUSSMAN
